title.value: On the estimation of discrete choice models to capture irrational customer behaviors
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the document and matches the content discussed in the paper.
title.quote: On the estimation of discrete choice models to capture irrational customer behaviors

extractions.description: This paper proposes an estimation method for the Generalized Stochastic Preference choice model, which is capable of capturing both rational and irrational customer behaviors. The paper discusses how to use partially-ranked preferences to efficiently model these behaviors from transaction data and assesses the predictive accuracy of the proposed approach using extensive experiments.

type.justification: The paper presents a new estimation method and assesses its predictive accuracy through extensive experiments.
type.quote: An extensive set of experiments assesses the predictive accuracy of the proposed approach.

name.justification: The paper focuses on modeling irrational consumer choice behaviors, which is a topic within behavioral economics.
name.quote: However, behavioral economics has provided strong empirical evidence of irrational choice behavior, such as halo effects, that are incompatible with this framework.

name.justification: The paper discusses estimation methods, optimization problems, and model generalization, which are core Machine Learning concepts.
name.quote: Our work spans several areas of research... We then survey the works from the Machine Learning and Operation Management communities.

name.justification: The paper discusses choice models in the context of retail operations and supply-chain optimization.
name.quote: Accurately forecasting the demand of certain products or services is of crucial importance in the context of supply-chain optimization and retail operations.

name.justification: The GSP model is central to the paper, which proposes a method for estimating this model.
name.quote: The Generalized Stochastic Preference (GSP) choice model, an extension of rank-based choice models introduced by Berbeglia (2018) to capture halo effects, is one of the recently proposed models that fits into this stream of literature.

is_contributed.justification: The GSP model was introduced in prior work by Berbeglia (2018) and not contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Despite being theoretically attractive, the estimation of the GSP choice model poses significant challenges both from the computational and predictive points of view.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not provide any specific evidence that the GSP model was executed as part of this research work.
is_executed.quote: The authors suggest that estimation procedures originally developed for rational rank-based choice models may be adapted to their irrational choice model.

is_compared.justification: The paper explicitly compares the predictive accuracy of various models, including the GSP model.
is_compared.quote: Our algorithm outperforms, on average, two baselines from the literature on irrational choice modeling, the Halo-MNL and the Pairwise Choice Markov Chain (PCMC) when tested on real-world data.

referenced_paper_title.value: The generalized stochastic preference choice model
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper is Berbeglia's introduction of the Generalized Stochastic Preference model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Another general approach for which no empirical result has been reported is the Generalized Stochastic Preference choice model (Berbeglia 2018).

name.justification: The IRI Academic dataset is used for experiments to test the models' performance on real-world data.
name.quote: In this section, we test all approaches on the IRI Academic data-set (Bodea et al. 2009), a real-world data-set from the retail sector.

referenced_paper_title.value: Data set—choice-based revenue management: Data from a major hotel chain
referenced_paper_title.justification: The IRI Academic dataset is referenced with a study by Bodea et al. (2009).
referenced_paper_title.quote: Bodea, Tudor, Mark Ferguson, Laurie Garrow. 2009. Data set—choice-based revenue management: Data from a major hotel chain. Manufacturing & Service Operations Management.

name.justification: NumPy is a fundamental package for scientific computing and is typically used for array handling and mathematical functions, fitting the context of the paper's empirical work.
name.quote: Not explicitly mentioned; inferred from typical empirical methods for handling datasets and computational models.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The precise reference title is not provided in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Not explicitly mentioned; inferred from the context.
